intro: Berberis × frikartii, commonly known as the hybrid barberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant produces orange-red berries that are edible but often have a bitter taste. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value comes from its vibrant foliage and seasonal interest throughout the year.
